word:
When suffering under reproach, Hannah cried to the Lord, and the Lord heard her prayer, and gave her a son. Then she declared the glory of the Lord, saying, "The Lord is a God of knowledge, and by him actions are weighed." Again, Isaiah says, "Thou, most upright, do weigh the path of the just." Solomon declares, "All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes, but the Lord weigheth the spirit." And David 
                                                                           1669
writes, writes, "Men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be wighed in the balances they are altogether lighter than vanity.
